action.action-desc: Mr. Good of Virginia (for himself, Mrs. Miller of Illinois, Mr. Harris, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Tiffany, Mr. Gohmert, Mr. Norman, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Moolenaar, Mr. Duncan, and Mr. Perry) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To amend the National Labor Relations Act to adjust the dollar thresholds for National Labor Relations Board jurisdiction over certain labor disputes, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Small Businesses before Bureaucrats Act.

section.header: Increase of dollar threshold for National Labor Relations Board jurisdiction over certain labor disputes

subsection.text: Section 14(c) of the National Labor Relations Act (29 U.S.C. 164(c)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3); and
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following:

In establishing by rule any dollar threshold with respect to a class or category of employers for the purposes of declining to assert jurisdiction over certain labor disputes involving such class or category of employers, the Board shall establish such dollar threshold at an amount—

subparagraph.text: for calendar year 2022, equal to the product of—

clause.text: the dollar threshold applicable to such class or category as of the day prior to the date of enactment of this paragraph, multiplied by

subparagraph.text: for any calendar year after 2022, equal to the product of—

clause.text: the dollar threshold applicable to such class or category for calendar year 2022 (after the date of enactment of this paragraph), multiplied by

subclause.text: the Personal Consumption Expenditure Per Capita Index (as published by the Bureau of Economic Analysis) for such calendar year after 2022; by
the Personal Consumption Expenditure Per Capita Index for calendar year 2022.

subsection.header: Personal consumption expenditure per capita index
subsection.text: The Bureau of Economic Analysis of the Department of Commerce shall prepare and publish an index reflecting expenditures for personal consumption by Americans on a per capita basis for each year, beginning calendar year 2023, and such index shall be known as the Personal Consumption Expenditure Per Capita Index.

The amendments made by this section shall apply to any decision of the National Labor Relations Board relating to the assertion of its jurisdiction over a labor dispute made after the date of enactment of this section.
